meanings.definition: relating to or resembling a shield
meanings.sent1: The knight wore a scutal armor for protection.
meanings.sent2: The scutal design on the shield was intricate and beautiful.
meanings.sent3: The scutal shield gleamed in the sunlight, blinding the enemy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a scutal barrier against his anger.
meanings.sent5: The scutal shield stood tall, a symbol of strength and defense.

meanings.definition: of or relating to the scutum (a shield-shaped plate on the thorax of certain insects)
meanings.sent1: The scutal pattern on the beetle's back was fascinating.
meanings.sent2: The scutal structure of the insect provided natural protection.
meanings.sent3: The tiny scutal shield on the bug made it look like a miniature knight.
meanings.sent4: The beetle's scutal armor was its armor against predators.
meanings.sent5: The scutal shield on the insect's thorax shimmered in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: pertaining to the scutum (a shield-shaped plate on the thorax of certain insects)
meanings.sent1: The scutal features of the ant made it look like a tiny warrior.
meanings.sent2: The scutal structure of the beetle provided camouflage in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The ant's scutal shield was the envy of the other insects.
meanings.sent4: The beetle's scutal armor was its pride and protection.
meanings.sent5: The scutal shield on the ant's body was its shield against danger.
